alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Davidson; Montgomery; Moore; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 7:04PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Davidson, Montgomery, Moore and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 704 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Asheboro, North Carolina Zoo, Seagrove, Robbins, Star, Steeds, Ulah, Coleridge, Highfalls, Martha, Eldorado, Harpers Crossroads and Glendon. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Glendon-Carthage Rd and Rascob Rd and Creeks near S Kennedy St in Robbins. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
